ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'þrīe', from Proto-Germanic '*þrīz', from Proto-Indo-European '*tréyes'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A number expressing quantity; a cardinal number.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The cardinal number equivalent to the sum of one and two; one more than two; 3.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与一加二的和相等的基数；比二多一；3。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She has three cats and two dogs.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A group or set of three people or things.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 三个人或物的组合或一套。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The three of us went to the concert together.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们三个人一起去听了音乐会。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word naming an attribute of a noun, such as sweet, red, or technical.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He served three terms as president.
